page.title: 05THE SOAR NAVIGATION
page.content: The{River Soar}is mainly used by private{cruisers}and{narrowboats.}The fish in the River are{Perch, Pike, {Roach}and{Gudgeon.}You see lots of fishermen around the Weir. Narrowboats are just as popular as cruisers but narrowboats are made of steel where cruisers are made of glass reinforced fibre. The{Lock}is 12ft deep. It is called{Barrow Deep Lock.}You can see {moorhens, coots, dabchicks, ducks}and {geese.}The Soar is not near any roads so it is very quiet. There are trees all down the side so you go down a sort of tunnel.{Hired boats}come down the Soar. The nearest hire boat bases are at Shardlow and Sawley, but they are day boats. There is a big step weir in Barrow. People use{dinghies and{canoes}as well. Boats have inboard or outboard engines. There are four canal bridges in Barrow.{DAVID ROBERTS
